definitions.definition: a device that measures and records the amount of electricity, gas, water, etc. that you have used or the time and distance you have travelled, etc.

examples.text: A man came to read the gas meter.
The cab driver left the meter running while he waited for us.
Installing a **smart meter** will allow you to see how much water you are using in real time.

definitions.definition: a machine next to the road that you put money into when you park your car next to it
a device for measuring the thing mentioned
a unit for measuring length; a hundred centimetres

examples.text: an athlete running at 10 meters per second

definitions.definition: used in the name of races

examples.text: Who holds the record in the 100 meters?

definitions.definition: the arrangement of strong and weak stresses in lines of poetry that produces the rhythm; a particular example of this

wordOrigin: noun senses 1 to 2 Middle English (in the sense ‘person who measures’): from mete + -er. The current sense dates from the 19th cent.
